questions.question: Which Health Issues can be treated using a Holistic Treatment Approach?

answer.p: Holistic Health is a form of healing that looks at the whole person - body, mind, spirit, and emotions - in the quest for optimal health and wellness. The uniqueness of each patient is emphasized by the holistic health approach, as well as their daily surroundings. The holistic health practitioners believe that the whole is constituted of many interdependent parts and imbalances in one part can affect the overall health.
The treatment and techniques used are to assist the individual in living a healthy lifestyle as a whole in harmony with nature.

a.a: Chronic Pain: Study of Complementary and Alternative Treatments

answer.p: Pain is the most common reason people seek health care and the leading cause of disability in the world. One in every 10 adults suffer from chronic pain. Pain that lasts or recurs for more than three months is referred to as chronic pain. It interferes with many daily activities - physically, psychologically and emotionally and one of the goals of acute or chronic pain management is to reduce the effect of pain on a person's function and quality of life. The ability to resume routine activity, maintain a positive affect or mood, and sleep are relevant functions for a person. and it exerts an enormous personal and economic burden, affecting more than 30% of people worldwide.

questions.question: What is the importance of mind - body therapy in pain management?

answer.p: The mind - body therapies such as meditation, yoga, taichi, reiki, guided imagery, CBT, etc which involves practicing attention control, emotional regulation, and self-awareness. There is increased perception and awareness with mindfulness practices, and these mind - body therapy addresses both the sensory and emotional components of pain. The brain’s ability to react to painful stimuli with an emotional response decreases, and a person is more likely to respond calmly to a stimulus instead of having a hasty emotional reaction like; hurt, pain, anger, etc.

questions.question: Which types of pain are treatable using a holistic approach?

answer.p: Pain is an unpleasant sensory or emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage. It is always subjective to each individual and can vary from a slightly bothersome, such as a mild headache, to something excruciating and emergent, such as the chest pain that accompanies a heart attack, or pain of kidney stones. Pain can be acute, meaning new and chronic, when it lasts for more than 3 months.

Chronic pain is one of the most prevalent health problems that contributes to loss of productivity, efficiency and increases the health expenses. It has been linked to increased risk of major psychological conditions including unrefreshing sleep, fatigue, depression, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder.

When a person is diagnosed with pain, the first line of treatment is typically pain medication. But while these medications may work for some people, in others, the side effects—ranging from nausea, acidity — may outweigh the relief.

For those looking for holistic pain management, a complementary & alternative therapy (CAM) specialist can treat various issues like Muscle and skeletal issues that result in neck, shoulder, and back pain, neurological issues such as headaches, Lifestyle related such as postural problems, stress related, women care like PCOS, menopausal, sports injuries, old-age related bones, joints, muscles, and ligaments, such as arthritis. Fatigue, pain, swelling, stiffness and loss of muscle strength. Thus, these therapies help minimize pain, maximize function, and improve quality of life.

questions.question: Can I take up this treatment along with conventional - Allopathy - treatment?

answer.p: Complementary and Alternative treatments (CAM) are used alongside conventional treatments, the majority of medical doctors find most forms of complementary medicine acceptable. It is important to keep your treating physicians aware about the use of complementary medicine. CAM therapies are widely used in the western population, as nearly 40% of adults in the U.S. use some form of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) and the majority of individuals (54.9%) used CAM in conjunction with conventional medicine. Most people use CAM to treat and/or prevent musculoskeletal conditions or other conditions associated with chronic or recurring pain.

questions.question: What Is A Healthy Nutrition Plan?

answer.p: A healthy eating plan gives your body the nutrients it needs every day. A healthy eating plan: emphasizes vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and fat-free or low-fat dairy products. Avoid low in saturated fats, trans fats, cholesterol, salt (sodium), and added sugars. Drink plenty of water.

Having good nutrition plays an important part of leading a healthy lifestyle. When you combine it with physical activity, your healthy eating can help you to reach and maintain a healthy weight, reduce your risk of chronic diseases (like heart disease and cancer), and promote your overall health

questions.question: What is the importance of mental health/ mind care?

answer.p: Mental health is important at every stage of life. It affects both emotional and mental health. It impacts your thoughts, behaviors and emotions. Being healthy emotionally can promote productivity and effectiveness in all of your daily activities.
